title: University of Idaho to demolish off-campus home where 4 students were killed
description: The university said it will tear down the King Street house in Moscow, Idaho, where a 28-year-old man killed four students in November.

title: A major winter storm has prompted blizzard and flood warnings across California
description: Blizzard warnings continued in the mountains and flood advisories blanketed the region, but forecasters offered some relief, predicting the storm would taper off later in the day on Saturday.

title: FDA authorizes the first at-home test for COVID-19 and the flu
description: The at-home nasal swab kit simultaneously tests for COVID-19 and two strains of the flu.

title: Five people died after an air ambulance crashed in western Nevada
description: The airplane included a pilot, nurse, paramedic, a patient and family member of the patient. The cause of the crash has yet to be determined.

title: Italy has kept its fascist monuments and buildings. The reasons are complex
description: Unlike Germany, which after World War II underwent a rigorous de-Nazification effort, pride, rather than shame, is the emotion many Italians feel for the symbols of the country's fascist past.

title: The key trends to watch in the Russia-Ukraine war
description: Russia's military has performed poorly, and Ukraine has defied expectations. But will these trends hold? Experts look at how the war could take a different path in its second year.

title: Black married couples face heavier tax penalties than white couples, a report says
description: The report is part of a growing body of research into whether institutions and policies reinforce preexisting racial disparities.

title: People smugglers keep trying to recruit this boat captain. Here's why he says no
description: By day, Saint-Louis native Pape Dieye is a boat captain-turned-tour guide for a fancy hotel that caters to Westerners. By night, he turns down requests to smuggle human beings across the ocean.

title: Dead whales on the east coast fuel misinformation about offshore wind development
description: Experts don't know what's behind the years-long trend of whale deaths. But there's no evidence connecting the deaths to offshore wind development, which is less noisy than fossil fuel exploration.

title: After Russian forces occupied Kherson, ordinary citizens fought back from the shadows
description: Residents of the Russian-speaking city became partisans who fought for the independence of Ukraine. The nine-month occupation is over, but Russia continues to shell the city.

title: Turkey's Antakya is in ruins after the quake, erasing cultural and religious heritage
description: The city of Antakya, known in antiquity as Antioch, was at the crossroads of civilizations for centuries. After the Feb. 6 earthquake, many of its centuries-old monuments and sites lie in ruins.

title: In East Palestine, who 'shows up' isn't necessarily a sign of who's helping
description: East Palestine, Ohio, has been devastated by a train derailment and chemical burn off that has threatened the health of residents, but it has now also become the center of political controversy.

title: Despite high inflation, Americans are spending like crazy – and it's kind of puzzling
description: Americans began the new year with a spending spree, but businesses are not sure how long it can last. There's a lot riding on the answer, since consumer spending is the backbone of the U.S. economy.

title: Federal authorities are investigating another near runway collision between planes
description: A Mesa Airlines jet was landing on the same runway a SkyWest plane was using to take off. It's the fourth such runway incursion over the last several weeks.
